textBox.richText: JIVE stands for Jos Image Viewer Extravaganza. In 6.828, our operating systems class, we implemented a basic shell, which we called JOS. For our final project, Adam and I decided to do a basic image viewer for JOS. This involved dropping into v8086 environment to emulate real mode and then writing code for the vesa graphics driver. We then wrote a small graphics library and a bitmap reader library. Our final implementation allowed the user to toggle through various bitmap images, as well as play a sequence of bitmap images using our animated bitmap viewer.
Fall 2011 6.828 Operating Systems Final Project Jennifer Chan, Adam Leonard
